statements: SELECT * FROM PhylogeneticData;
SELECT species_name, evolutionary_relationship FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE species_id = 1;
SELECT species_name, common_ancestor FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE evolutionary_relationship = 'Distant';
SELECT * FROM PhylogeneticData ORDER BY species_id DESC;
SELECT species_name, common_ancestor FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE common_ancestor IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE evolutionary_relationship = 'ancestor'
SELECT species_name, common_ancestor FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE species_id = 3
SELECT species_id, species_name FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE common_ancestor IS NULL
SELECT * FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE species_name LIKE '%a%' ORDER BY species_name DESC
SELECT species_name, common_ancestor FROM PhylogeneticData WHERE evolutionary_relationship = 'descendant'
SELECT species_name, kingdom FROM species WHERE species_id = 1
SELECT * FROM species WHERE kingdom = 'Animalia'
SELECT family, species_name FROM species ORDER BY family DESC
SELECT * FROM evolutionary_relationships WHERE relationship_type = 'sibling'
SELECT order_name, species_name FROM species WHERE kingdom = 'Plantae'
SELECT * FROM species WHERE kingdom = 'Animalia' ORDER BY species_name DESC
SELECT species_id, species_name FROM species WHERE family LIKE 'Canidae%'
SELECT species_name, kingdom FROM species WHERE kingdom = 'Plantae' AND family = 'Poaceae'
SELECT * FROM species ORDER BY kingdom, family
SELECT DISTINCT kingdom FROM species ORDER BY kingdom
SELECT * FROM Species;
SELECT species_id, species_name, common_name FROM Species WHERE classification = 'Mammal';
SELECT family_name, genus_name FROM Genus ORDER BY genus_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Family WHERE order_name = 'Carnivora';
SELECT species_name, common_name FROM Species WHERE classification = 'Reptile' ORDER BY species_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM Species WHERE species_name LIKE '%bird%';
SELECT species_name, common_name, classification FROM Species ORDER BY species_name DESC;
SELECT family_name, genus_name FROM Family JOIN Genus ON Family.family_name = Genus.family_name;
SELECT * FROM Genus WHERE genus_name = 'Canis';
SELECT s.species_name, g.genus_name, f.family_name FROM Species s JOIN Genus g ON s.genus_name = g.genus_name JOIN Family f ON g.family_name = f.family_name;
SELECT * FROM species;
SELECT species_name, family_id FROM species WHERE species_id = 1;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM family WHERE family_name = 'Canidae';
SELECT genus_name FROM genus WHERE family_id = 3 ORDER BY genus_name ASC;
SELECT species_id, ancestor_id FROM phylogeny WHERE species_id = 10 ORDER BY ancestor_id DESC;
SELECT species_name, family_name FROM species INNER JOIN family ON species.family_id = family.family_id WHERE species_id = 1;
SELECT species_name, genus.genus_name, family_name FROM species INNER JOIN genus ON species.family_id = genus.family_id INNER JOIN family ON genus.family_id = family.family_id WHERE species_id = 2;
SELECT genus.genus_name, COUNT(species_id) AS species_count FROM genus LEFT JOIN species ON genus.genus_id = species.species_id GROUP BY genus.genus_name HAVING species_count > 2;

SELECT phylogeny_id, species.species_name AS species_name, ancestor.species_name AS ancestor_name FROM phylogeny INNER JOIN species ON phylogeny.species_id = species.species_id INNER JOIN species AS ancestor ON phylogeny.ancestor_id = ancestor.species_id;

SELECT family_name, AVG(species.species_id) AS avg_species_id FROM family LEFT JOIN genus ON family.family_id = genus.family_id LEFT JOIN species ON genus.genus_id = species.species_id GROUP BY family_name;
SELECT * FROM Species;
SELECT name, scientific_name, kingdom FROM Species WHERE class='Mammalia';
SELECT id, genus, family FROM Species WHERE kingdom='Animalia' ORDER BY genus DESC;
SELECT id, name FROM Species WHERE phylum='Chordata' AND class='Reptilia';
SELECT name, family, genus FROM Species WHERE kingdom='Plantae' AND phylum='Angiosperms';
SELECT * FROM Species WHERE kingdom='Animalia';
SELECT name, scientific_name FROM Species WHERE class='Mammalia' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT * FROM EvolutionaryRelationship WHERE relationship_type='ancestor-descendant' ORDER BY species_id, related_species_id DESC;
SELECT s.name, g.sequence FROM Species s JOIN GeneticSequence g ON s.id = g.species_id WHERE g.date_created >= '2021-01-01';

SELECT r.name AS researcher_name, r.email AS researcher_email, p.name AS tree_name, p.description AS tree_description FROM Researcher r JOIN PhylogeneticTree p ON r.id = p.root_species_id WHERE r.institution='University X';
